author: phillygrl
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on September 21, 2016
review_content: I've been using this garden sprayer now for about 5 months and It has always worked perfectly.  This sprayer is so easy to use.  The way it works is you fill the sprayer with your choice chemical, pump the handle until the air pressure builds (you will feel the resistance in the handle when the pressure is built) point the nozzle and spray.  So easy!  The container is a good thick quality, wand is 12" and the hose is 28" which makes maneuverability nice and easy.  This sprayer has a convenient funnel top which helps prevent liquid from running down the sides when you are filling it.I use this with insecticidal soap on my houseplants and on my garden plants.  The spray is nice and even and it has a nice wide spray width.  The nozzle is adjustable and the wand is easy to reach into bushes or up into small trees.  This sprayer mists everything leaving a nice coat on the leaves without dumping out too much product.  This is nice because my liquid lasts longer.  I have never had any issues with this sprayer and would recommend this.  If this review is helpful to you in any way, please let me know by clicking on helpful.  Thank you so much!!  :)
title: Works Great Everytime!!!

author: Alice Wakefield
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on May 18, 2017
review_content: I bought the Chapin four years ago and it's still working, with occasional tip cleaning using vinegar or CLR.  It's never quite as "misty" as I'd like, but it's adequate for spraying weeds, and for the price I can't complain. The wand and tips are usually the weak points in these home sprayers, so  I looked into buying new ones but it was more than the complete tank.It probably doesn't help that I leave chemicals in it for extended periods. I once left liquid in it so long that I forgot whether it was weed killer or insecticide, so disposed of it by spraying an area that needed both.  I then decided to get another dedicated sprayer and label them.  This seemed easier than cleaning them out after every use because that's just not gonna happen, to be honest.The lock and release action of the pump mechanism for carrying is smoother and easier than with others I've tried, and given the abuse it takes it's a great deal.The Smith was twice as much, and the wand is a bit longer.  It feels more robust and sprays mistier, but that could change.  The twist and lock action isn't as smooth as the Chapin, but other than that they're pretty similar.
title: Four years later, still working

author: Jason
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on July 23, 2017
review_content: The locking mechanism on stem of handle consists of a tiny plastic tab. If you don't tighten this mechanism up enough, air will escape and it won't do the job. If you tighten it up too much, the tiny plastic tab will break... rendering this product useless. The latter happened to me. Received this product a week ago, and it's worthless after only 2 uses. Don't even know if it's worth the effort to try to return this product since I already tossed the packaging in the garbage.
title: rendering this product useless. The latter happened to me

author: Ringading
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on April 21, 2016
review_content: This is an extremely well made garden sprayer, easy to use, maintains good pressure, clear volume markings.It takes about 3 pressurizations to empty the sprayer. I have to give kudos to Chapin. Not only is this a great sprayer, but when I called them to make sure the extendable wand I wanted to add was compatible, the person who answered knew immediately what I was doing, and was also aware that the nozzle that came with this sprayer would NOT fit the wand and sent me one that would fit at no charge which arrived before the sprayer and wand did! Now this is just a small plastic part, but essential for operation. I am very impressed with this company's foresight and service and will look at other Chapin products in the future.Now I'd like to also rave about the wand purchased through Amazon, Chapin #6-7770 32-Inch Extendable Wand with Viton. The extendable part is brass and is slightly bent at the tip. The bend is important because just by turning your hand slightly while spraying, you can get the underside of the leaves. It fits the hose that comes with the sprayer. When it is fully extended, I can get the top branches of a pear tree that is roughly 15 feet high.
title: Great product has 12 inch wand, 28 inch hose, and compatible with the Chapin 32 inch extendable wand.

You pump it and pump it till you feel the resistance, but then when you go to spray  it, hardly anything comes out.  I brought it to 2 garden centers and they couldn't get it to work either.
title: I am returning this sprayer, as it just won't ...

author: Rebekahra
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on July 29, 2017
review_content: This sprayer is amazing! I bought it to spray my yellow spots in my lawn with LawnStar. I used the Home Depot HDX brand last year and it got clogged every 5 minutes. It was very frustrating. This sprayer didn't get clogged once and I was able to spray my lawn much faster!

author: Homer
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on June 5, 2019
review_content: I filled this with an oxyclean solution so that I could spray down my roof deck. The sprayer was slightly pressurized and as I was carrying it up to the deck the seam at the bottom sprung a leak and flooded inside the house. I am not happy with this product.
title: Seam burst

author: Bill G.
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on May 4, 2016
review_content: This review is for sprayer compression bottle listed her under name "Chapin 20000 1-Gallon Poly Lawn and Garden Sprayer".It works, I was able to spray all my weeds with success. Long handle very useful and allows you to direct spray where it is intended.So why is the four star and not five? The reason is simple, quality of the product and plastic used is very poor. Bottle quality is OK, it has to be or it will not hold pressure, but the actual sprayer is very flimsy and will not last. To be honest, this product never lasted me more than one year. I get it every spring and no matter what company or how much I pay for it lasts the same. It is true you can replace broken/clogged parts, but it will cost you about the same as replace the whole thing, so why bother...
title: good product, but life expectancy about one year...

author: CK
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on July 29, 2020
review_content: **UPDATE** After contacting Chapin, they offered a replacement. I appreciated that offer. The replacement arrived and it was only the pump handle assembly. The old assembly is embedded / broken off in the old tank and not easy to remove. I ended up drilling into the old assembly and tried to extract it that way. I broke drill bits but that's my own fault. By the time I got the old broke assembly out, I had unfortunately drilled into the tank body a tiny bit. This is because there is nothing of substance in the center of the assembly and you must drill near where it meets the tank threading. This caused my unit to leak slightly when pressurized; it still works but it also sprays solution mist on my hand and arm instead of the intended target.Original review:I used this sprayer 3-4 times a week for 2 months. I enjoyed the form factor, the handle, and the wand with adjustable sprayer tip. This sprayer would have come highly recommended by me except for one fatal design flaw.Everything hinges on the pump handle. When it's full, there is very little stability in holding this device by the intended handle.To tighten the lid you must turn the pump handle. It catches the lid assembly by two small blocks. Those blocks are horribly undersized and should have been re-enforced. If you tighten the lid adequately tight to form a seal and try to loosen it, it could break on you. They broke on me with relatively little force. When these tiny pieces break, it renders the entire unit landfill trash. In an emergency, i had to use a funnel to supply some product to the cylinder since the pumping and spraying mechanism still technically work - however it would be too cumbersome to do this daily.
title: Worked nicely for 2 months

author: Robert T. Wolfington
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on December 4, 2018
review_content: If I could, I would give this sprayer a big zero star, I bought this item to use for weed spraying, I thought it would be great after reading so many positive reviews, I couldn't have been more wrong. There were two major issues with this thing, the first of which in my opinion makes it worthy of a recall. After using the sprayer as directed, it looked like it was completely out of spray and air in the container but when I opened it up to refill it, it vented directly into my face, wetting my eyes with weed killer, going into my mouth and onto my face. This sprayer shouldn't even be capable of doing something like that, there should be some sort of safety measure on it to prevent that from ever happening. The other problem is that while walking around the yard holding the handle while I was spraying, it kept coming unlatched and causing the handle to come loose. None of this was from my improper use, it was due to a defective and poor design. It is a horrible item, it shouldn't even be being sold, I do not reccomend it.  ~Robert's Wife~

author: Kindle Customer

review_content: Item arrived on time and in perfect condition. Box is undamaged.First time I used it I got soaked. A fine spray of liquid is coming out of the bottom of the tank. author: Steven Berry
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on February 7, 2017
review_content: I have two of these and I use them for multiple things.I spray ant hills with a natural ant hill irritant to make them move off my general walking areas like around my fence gates that i can't open when they build mounds there.I use it to stain my fences, spray the stain and wipe it with a cloth to evenly coat surfaces, that's one of the reasons I carry two. you could paint like this too. screw Huckleberry Finn's method of scamming everyone to do it for me, use this. it's simple.I use it to spray a chemical called Wet and Forget, it's mixed with water and i can pressurize it pretty good to hit the high areas with an even spray and put enough on it to wet the entire surface. - that product is great - this pump sprayer is cheap and effective to deliver it.I live in the south and we get mossy surfaces that don't get direct sunlight. I could build an Archimedes laser system to bounce the sunlight across the side of the house to kill that stuff but this pump spray and a low-cost alternative that works.It would be cool if you cold make something to look like a Ghostbusters thing. I would love to run around my yard and house with two of these engineered into mock ghost busters piped system and do my yard work and useful type things with these tanks on my back like a slime shooter or something.. pew pew. yay for home ownership.But you have to pump this a lot. and it gets really pressurized, so if you have chemicals that are slightly toxic or irritants, make sure you depressurize it by holding the trigger until it doesn't spray before you open it.  and I suggest doing that for storage. don't keep it pressurized. the thing will explode under pressure in a hot garage.Safety first.
title: It's a squirty and spraying pump pressure pot squirt gun! works really well. and made well.

author: Daekwan

author: Little mum
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on June 11, 2017
review_content: Completely defective.  Connecting port for spray hose was actually sealed off with a cap on the inside of the canister. It was a thick cap of plastic solidly welded in place (thermal or ultrasonic welded) that I could not remove, so it was impossible to even insert the hose into the canister.  I thought about drilling a hole through it the cap so I could get the hose in, but that would not have made a difference since there was a second defect in the canister:  a big hole drilled in the side opposite the sealed hole - this hole had no thread or connector, so there was no way to attach the hose. So with a gaping hole in the side it was impossible to pressurize the container, even if I could have forced the hose through the sealed port.  This product is therefore completely useless.  They need some quality control.
title: Multiple defects right out of the package = useless

author: N.E.T.
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on June 4, 2017
review_content: I don't usually take the time to review things. I agree with most of the reviews, and buy what most other people like. This time, however, I bought something that most people like, this sprayer, and I find it to be a flimsy piece of junk even considering the price compared to the Roundup sprayer that I had purchased previously. The Roundup sprayer, coincidentally is about $3 more, but it is certainly worth the extra money. This sprayer is 100% plastic, including the pumping lever, which will likely break in about a week or so. The Roundup sprayer has a sturdy metal handle. The sprayer wand on Roundup is much longer, made of metal and more substantial and has a locking button so that you can continue to spray without keeping your hand down on the spray mechanism the entire time. You can't build up enough pressure on this tiny plastic mechanism to spray more than one arborvitae for bagworms.  The Roundup can hold more pressure and pump longer. Get the Roundup. This one isn't really made in USA. It's made in USA with crap Global materials.  Roundup is made in USA.
title: Get the Roundup for a few bucks more

author: Navy Seal
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on January 24, 2018
review_content: An old adage says "You get what you pay for". Sometimes you get lucky and get an inexpensive item that is also a good value, unfortunately this sprayer is not one of these items.This is an "inexpensive sprayer" for people who want a sprayer around the house for occasional use. It is not a well made sprayer, but then what do you expect for this price. I will keep the sprayer in my garage as a backup, but I have ordered a better more expensive sprayer. author: Geek Ambrosia
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on May 22, 2016
review_content: This sprayer works great for what it is. author: P.W.A.

review_content: Excellent value sprayer. One thing, when are finished you need to relieve all the pressure by spraying until the stream is week. author: BAMOR
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on January 1, 2018
review_content: Update:  I love this tool for cleaning!  I keep finding more uses.  While I still use spray bottles, I use this for bigger cleaning projects to mist various cleaning solutions.  It is great for spraying on window cleaner on windows outside the house.  Works for laying down a fine mist of cleaning solution on patio furniture.  It can be used to mist a cleaning solution on your car.  I use the washing soda and dish soap solution in the tank as well as a vinegar and water solution.  I believe any cleaning solution could be added to the tank.  I may try a solution with dish soap to spray roses for aphids.  I am very pleased with this purchase.Original review:I didn't buy this for yard use.  I purchased it to mist a popcorn ceiling to help with removal.  The popcorn ceiling had previously been painted, so misting didn't facilitate removal.  However, this tool was so easy to use, I figured out how to repurpose it around the house.I needed to clean some folding chairs.  I added hot water, a few drops of dawn dish washing liquid and 1/2 cup Arm and Hammer WASHING SODA (this is NOT baking soda!) to the container.  I put the chairs in the shower one at a time and sprayed them liberally with the Washing Soda solution and scrubbed them with a brush.  Rinsed with the shower wand.My next project was to spot clean a carpet.  I sprayed the Washing Soda solution on the worst areas prior to shampooing the carpet.  This sprayer made it easy to lay down a controlled mist without soaking the carpet.My third cleaning project was a fabric upholstered recliner.  I sprayed the Washing Soda solution on the chair and then towel dried it.This doesn't work like a pressure washer.  What it does is lay down a light mist.  Going back over an area more than once will give you heavier coverage.Oven racks may be a future project.  I'll take them outside to clean while the oven is self cleaning.The tank size is perfect for household use.  Not too big or heavy when filled.  I have used spray bottles for years.  This sprayer is much easier to use than a spray bottle.
title: Who knew?  Forget the lawn. This is an awesome cleaning tool!

author: E D

review_content: The sprayer actually works - at least so far. author: alfisch
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on May 15, 2021
review_content: Easy enough to use, but not particularly safe. I was surprised to learn that the pressure release happens when the user unscrews the pump from the top of the tank. Problem is, residue from whatever you are spraying is blown in any direction which is neither mentioned, nor safeguards suggested such as laying a cloth or old towel over the top of the tank to prevent spray from reaching the user. As these lawn and garden sprayers are frequently used to apply chemicals such as pesticides or herbicides, I am surprised they are allowed to make a unit like this without a dedicated pressure release valve.Other than that, this is an adequate basic sprayer suitable for non- toxic liquids. It is possible that there are some disclaimers buried deep in the legalese, but nothing obvious like warning labels that are on so many potentially harmful products.
title: Potentially harmful to users.

author: Aaron Davis
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on May 21, 2021
review_content: I bought this to wash, the pollen and light road grime off the car. I live in an apartment that does not have a car wash area or access to a spigot. This little beauty, with one fill up, handled the initial rinse and the after wash rinse off with no problems. More than enough pressure and tank volume to complete my full-size 4 door german sedan (not a small car)The extra bonus was after I was done, I drained the rest of the tank out repressurized, cleared the water mist and used the air to clear the water droplets from the car. I still had to wipe it dry but cut my time down by 75%.Great out of the box product. Just screwed the parts in and went to it. A definite must have for car enthusiast next I'll tackle the engine bay where you don't want high pressure or tons of water
title: Great for spraying off the car

author: some random guy
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on May 31, 2021
review_content: Good product other than the design of the pump handle. The two plastic tabs that engage the top to open and close the unit break after a few months of daily use. As you can see in the picture not much plastic actually makes contact with the plunger and WILL break at some point.I am an older guy lacking the strength to torque anything to the point of breaking so this isn't a case of me over aping it. Design flaw or defective unit.Now it is a pile of non recyclable plastic (my area at least) that will be a pain to dispose of properly.
title: Pump handle fails...

author: AC Too
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on May 14, 2020
review_content: I've ordered two of these. The first one works great, so I ordered another one and got it today. I took it out of the box, assembled it as I had the first one, pumped it up, sprayed once, and the top exploded out of the sprayer. Grass killer went everywhere, including all over my hands and feet. I'm not sure what happened, but I had to discard a gallon of solution. I returned it right away to our local UPS store, and ordered another one since the first one works well, after multiple uses. I'm hopeful the third one will work.This is why I gave three stars for this pump sprayer because the first one worked, the second exploded. If the third one works, I will raise the rating.
title: Purchased twice - first one works, the second one exploded

author: ChellyBelle
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on April 29, 2021
review_content: DOES NOT WORK!  At full pump (pressure completely built up), it a prays for a second or 2 then nothing.  So disappointing.  Unfortunately I hadn’t tried to use this thing until this morning (well after the return window).  So I can’t return it, but I can warn others against wasting their money as well.
title: Sprays for a second or 2 then stops 😡

author: kknutson
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on August 15, 2017
review_content: This  tank exploded today while I was using it to spray weed killer  I am at it less than one year and I clean it every time after I use it.  I rinse out the tank and then flush out the hose for clean water. I own two other tanks that I've had for over five years and they're working fine this one explodes after less than a year  when it exploded it sprayed me with the chemicals and I was lucky not to been injured or seriously maimed  for life this has taught me to never buy the cheapest chemical spraying tank it's not worth it.
title: tank exploded covering me with chemicals

author: Chris C.
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on July 10, 2016
review_content: Works fine, great value for the price.  I got it to spray neem oil on my plants and trees in my garden.  I filled it with water mixed with neem oil and natural soap, screwed on the lid and pumped it up about 16 times.  The nozzle can be adjusted to produce a narrow, concentrated stream, a wide, fine spray or anything in between.  After a few minutes, I had to add more pressure by pumping it again.  I did this maybe five times before applying all of the one gallon of mixture.  Thus, I was able to produce a continuous stream.  It was able to reach almost to the tops of the trees (maybe 12 feet in the air).  Although the stream is steady and reaches pretty far, not very much mixture is dispensed, so it does take a while to apply the entire gallon.NOTE:  Be very careful when opening the container after it is empty.  You should be sure to depressurize the container first, and then face away just in case.  Otherwise you may get a face full of spray.  Neem oil was not too bad, but I wouldn't want to get chemicals in my eyes.The body of the container is made of sturdy plastic, and it was shipped in a sturdy cardboard box to protect it from damage.
title: Works fine - be careful when opening

author: Eli Manning
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on June 8, 2021
review_content: This sprayer works just fine, but it lacks a pressure relief valve...sooooo, when you're done, either you leave it pressurized, or you have to unscrew the pump a bit to let the pressure out which, if it's not empty, spews the contents a bit.  I'm using it to spray deer repellent (which stinks) and it got me when I released the pressure...I'm letting it stay pressurized these days, but I'm concerned that may make it wear out quicker...other than that, it works fine....I've had it for a few years now, so I haven't hurt it yet.
title: OK, but...

author: Siyao
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on June 12, 2021
review_content: Overall it’s a quality product but it lacks several features I expect on a garden sprayer:1. Lock-on feature on the handle — using this as a garden sprayer (as its name suggests) I often have to spray a large area. I have to keep depressing the handle and this puts a lot of fatigue on my hand;2. Pressure relief valve — it not only prevents overpressurizing, but also helps when you want to open the bottle when it’s still pressurized;3. Flow adjuster knob — description says the flow is adjustable, but to be precise: the spray patter (zone vs jet) is adjustable and the flow changes correspondingly; I can’t adjust flow without adjusting the spray pattern.And it’s expensive. $12 isn’t too much, is it? Yes it is — compared to its counterpart available in every home improvement store named H*** D*****. that one has every missing feature I described above, AND it’s less than $10. Which town doesn’t have its H*** D****?Skip this and head to your local home improvement store for a better and cheaper alternative.
title: Too few features and not worth the money

author: JinxVia
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on May 11, 2019
review_content: I live in a walled community. A neighbor 2 houses down planted a creeping vine to cover his wall. It made its way to my wall and started choking my plants, creeping along my fence coming towards my house. Very invasive vine. I bought this, add the weed kill concentrate and pump the pressure. Works very well. I can shoot a stream at least 10 ft. I have to spray the invasive vine a couple times a year to keep it at bay. Without this, my property would be over run by now. Tried Roundup, but very expensive and the poison leaks st the sprayer and gets on my hands. The wand on this unit keeps my hands chemical free. Just don't use it on a windy day. I did that and it blew in my face.
title: Just what I needed

author: Michael H.
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on October 2, 2017
review_content: Ok. Having used this product for a while now I am going to write a review. For myself this product is fine. I use white vinegar as an herbicide.  The problem I consistently see with this is that the contents will sometimes rise up through the pump mechanism.  As I am using vinegar exposure is no risk at all. However,if you use a chemical herbicide (which I don't recommend anyway) I can in no way recommend this sprayer. I am not talking about a couple drops expressing on the pump handle. I am talking about quite a bit of fluid nearly filling the small well formed at the pump mechanism and container screw top.  Fine for me but if you want to use a commercial herbicide look for a different product.
title: Concern about a risk of exposure to chemicals.

author: Phil W.
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on August 17, 2016
review_content: Don't get me wrong this product worked perfectly for the first ever 45 mins I was using it (fresh from the box). It was spraying well and it was light weight when holding max fluid amount. When using it, a bit of maxing out the pressure before getting a perfect mist from the hose. Where it went all down hill was when it was time to depressurize for storage. The top of the pump was so tight from the pressure build up and my light hand tightening, that when it came to unscrewing it to release the pressure, the little lock nibs or "wings" attached to the pump broke off in the lock position when trying to loosen the top off. I wished that they used metal or something more sturdier when it came to this design. So the main point of this review is when loosening the top to depressurize, the little nibs might break and now your stuck with a $16-$23 Poly Spray bottle that you can never refill or use again. PURCHASE WITH CARE!!!!!!!
title: ***PLEASE READ BEFORE MAKING PURCHASE!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!***

author: TAC
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on August 8, 2020
review_content: My tank arrived and had excess plastic on the outside of the tank where the two halves are melded.  That made the tank's bottom not sit flat and had some sharp points on the untrimmed plastic.  I dressed the excess with a knife and file.  Oddly the interior of the tank appeared to be fine.  I called the phone number on the box to address the quality issue.  They were great and asked me for the manufacture date code embossed on the tank and asked for a photo.  They are making things right with a replacement.  I know that this is a very low priced product, but they appreciated the quality control issue.  Please have a picture ready for them to see the issue.  The wand's hand grip is smaller and may be ergonomically annoying for some larger hands.  But hey... it is a value driven product.  You aren't going to spray all day with a gallon capacity.
title: Untrimmed / sharp seams.  QC issue made good by manufacturer.  Small wand grip by design.

author: roundrocker
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on March 31, 2020
review_content: I have only used the sprayer once on a popcorn ceiling. My other sprayer suddenly stopped working. I had to use 2 small handheld sprayers to soften the popcorn. 4 hours later I was done. My hand and wrist had had a major workout. The Chapin 20000 arrived the next day. Assembling the sprayer was a no-brainer. Two minutes later I was filling the tank testing the pump.The sprayer put out a good stream of water onto the popcorn ceiling. I let it soak and sprayed a second time. I was so pleased. Four hours the day before became 1 hour in a larger room. Excellent sprayer.I will update this review in a few months.
title: Excellent Sprayer

author: Carolynn
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on May 13, 2020
review_content: I learned something this year. Veggies grow better when you spray the leaves with a liquid fertilizer.  I saw a video on youtube  that said to soak leaves and soil with the fertilizer early in the morning, twice a month. ( I use Neptune's Harvest Tomato and Veg.  liquid for all my veggies. Amazon has it, of course).This sprayer isn't too heavy for me to carry around, and not hard to pump either. The directions were a little unclear, but it's not too difficult to figure out how to put it together.  I especially like that the wand is long and I don't have to get too close to the plants to spray.  There's a bit of maintenance to keep it clean. This must be rinsed out after each use to avoid clogging.  I've already purchased two more of these. One for a weed killer (vinegar, salt, soap, water), and one for a garlic juice, hot sauce mixture to spray  garden bugs.  Good product.
title: Makes spraying liquid fertilizer on veggie garden very easy!  I got two more for weeds and bugs too.

author: I'm Pretty Picky
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on April 17, 2021
review_content: Though other sprayers have more features, you cannot beat the value this Chapin 2000 provides. It is almost fully assembled in the box, you only have to screw the hose to the tank.A big advantage to buying this over other sprayers is the fact the seals and other parts are widely available at most decent hardware stores.Please note the hose will be a bit stiff when you first get it, but it will become more pliable over time
title: Best Budget Sprayer

author: Lewis
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on May 27, 2020
review_content: I was surprised how good this thing worked! I got  it for spraying bug spray around the house. For the price I wasn’t sure what to expect. But what I know now is... it doesn’t leak, builds pressure quick, holds pressure, sprays a stream, sprays a fan, adjustments easy with a quick twist of the nozzle tip. Overall works great.I also have a ro**d up sprayer that was about $40, and this one is every bit as good. In fact the quality of the plastic container on the Chapin is thicker.  It’s just a little smaller, 1 gallon,  which is exactly what I wanted.If you want it to last, just make sure you release the pressure when you’re done. This way you’re not leaving pressure on the seals for long periods of down time. I will purchase Chapin sprayers from now on, you've  made a loyal customer. I was in no way paid or bribed to say this. They’ve earned the respect
title: If you’re looking. BUY IT!

author: CynthE
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on June 26, 2020
review_content: Afer pumping the sprayer, the pump sprayed into my face. This happened several times. In order for that to not happen, I could only pump very few times. I had to pump often because there was less pressure and the sprayer wouldn't spray for long. This made a drawn out time of the task at hand.
title: Couldn't handle  sufficient pressure

author: Robert H. Buckley
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on May 16, 2018
review_content: I was so happy with the first I bought a second one. These have multiple uses around the house and garden. I had tried hose end sprayers and found them a hassle to use and the spray quality very poor, as well as uneconomical because they simply spray too much water too fast. This tank sprayer is very ease to use. You can control the dilution and the amount to use, the pump action is not hard to operate (I found three pump sessions to a gallon right for me) and the nozzle provided gives a wide range of spray angles. When the pressure is high you can achieve a very fine mist for a while. I think with care these should stand up to a lot of usage. The price is also attractive. I can't imagine going back to the hose end versions.
title: Beats hose end sprayers and easy to operate

author: JW
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on December 28, 2020
review_content: Purchased this with the hope it would last longer than a certain sprayer with a name reminiscent of a cattle drive.  Used the other product as prescribed, rinsing after use and the whole bit.  After 3 uses, nothing going through the hoses.  Took the hoses off and blew through them all.  Air came through just fine.  blew through entire unit with trigger open and it worked.  Cleaned out the jug to ensure it was clean, filled it with water, pressurized it, and nothing through the hose.  Released pressure and there was pressure.  Tried several more times and just threw it out.  Used this one several times and cleaned afterwards each time.  Here's hopping it works the next time.
title: So far, so good.

author: Craig Wiley
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on March 22, 2021
review_content: Two things I don't like about this sprayer: (1) Seems to leak around spray control lever, wetting hand (2) The hose pops out of the tank sometimes during use after pumping up the tank, this resulted in pesticide being sprayed all over my face -- not good.  Buying a more expensive sprayer hoping this won't happen again.  Might not happen if pumped to a lower pressure, but I need higher pressure to reach certain spray targets.
title: Sprayer hose keeps popping off covering me with pesticide

author: T Fowl
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on March 1, 2020
review_content: The assembly was easy, and the seals were stable and secure to hold pressure. I filled it 2/3 full of water and pumped it about ten times maximum to get a good stream and the nozzle produced with refinement a mist that would be perfect for fruit trees and flowers.I have used cheap sprayer before and typically the main problem has been the o-ring seal breaking. This one is a little different seal so I hope it lasts longer.  Mostly I spray insecticide for ants and termite prevention around the house, patio, and storage shed. So a cheap sprayer that last 2-4 years is fine.
title: Good, Cheap Sprayer

author: Emma P
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on April 11, 2021
review_content: Was very happy with the first couple of uses of this - it seemed high quality, pressure was good, everything as expected. Unfortunately it stopped working after its first two outings and no longer holds pressure for more than a few seconds - the pump piece got a small abrasion and now leaks air rapidly. While I'll acknowledge that this was probably caused by me, it's also a little ridiculous that it doesn't hold up to light wear and tear from just a couple of typical uses. Hoping the next one I buy (which will not be this one) holds up a little better, if not I'll come back and admit that I'm a garden sprayer murderer.
title: Worked great, twice

author: Steve M
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on March 18, 2021
review_content: frankly, I'm not sure what the rave reviews are about based on my experience.We have a couple of these based on, thank you, reviews and price vs perceived value. It's a sprayer. The functionality is pretty straight forward. yet it leaks. and it doesn't preserve pressure in the canister which prevents it from building up so it can spray. the o-rings seem to get unseated pretty easily and all of this stuff is true in both of our sprayers.So, I've used them for about a season and now they go in the recycle bin. Thankfully they're not expensive but how many $10 sprayers do I need?
title: disappointing - worked for a couple months

author: Philc2001
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on July 26, 2020
review_content: We rarely use this sprayer, only when we have a plant with some pests, and maybe once a year to remove rust on the driveway. Well, we used twice, everything was fine. I verified it is not the pickup, not the spray wand, it is very specifically the black handle part with the lever. Nothing will go through. Crap.
title: Anti-clog got clogged - useless

author: L.D. Clements
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on June 29, 2020
review_content: I have owned the larger garden sprayer for years and bought this smaller container for small jobs. However after the first use, which was less than ideal since the pressure did not seem to hold, the sprayer does not pressurize at all. I have followed the instructions and I am also familiar with this brand having owned a working one for years without complaint. Either this is a "lemon" or not of good quality in design and materials. Very frustrating, not to mention a waste of time and money.
title: Will not pressurize

author: Chris Harrell
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on September 16, 2019
review_content: Had this sprayer for close to three years or maybe slightly over and still haven't had any issues with pump failure.  I used to buy one from Agri Supply and was replacing them every year due to pump failure...seals just enlarge with time and fell off.  Not this one...still pumping...still spraying.  The only issue I have with the sprayer is that the handle locking mechanism doesn't stay put.  When you're walking with the handle in hand, quite often the locking mechanism will come undone and the unit will just fall down the pump shaft.  But....I've just been re-locking and keep on working.  Hasn't damaged the unit from doing so, thus far.
title: Had almost three years--still working without pump failure

author: WannaRip
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on December 7, 2019
review_content: I bought this October 4, 2015.  It broke today 12-7-19. The little black plastic tab where you twist on snapped off.Overall this unit worked great.  I gave it five stars as it worked perfect for four years.  I used outdoor bleach and weed killer in it only. I used it quite a bit.  It did not just sit in the garage.The peak of my home is pretty high and this unit will spray all the way up there without the need for ladders. Makes cleaning my home so easy.Holds the pressure well and is easy to refill.I’m pleased and will order another one now.
title: Lasted over 4 years

author: Andy
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on May 3, 2021
review_content: This is the second one, as I exchanged the first because it leaked on the bottom and made a mess in my garage. This one sprung a leak on the bottom, too!. I mean c'mon man, what are the odds of the same thing happening twice? Must be a manufacturer's quality issue. Anyway, this one gets returned and I'll purchase another brand. Caveat emptor!

author: 44 second review

I just bought another cheap one, and consider these disposable after one season.

author: msanouk
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on March 14, 2021
review_content: Love this. Deer + rabbit repellent liquid sprayer got stuck over and over so I bought this. I was done spraying in 5 minutes and it gave me great!!!! coverage and control over amount I wanted to spray. Love this!!! Price is a bit high but it came through reliable when I needed to get job done. It took longer to assemble it and put on gloves and face shield to avoid stink of the repellent than it did to get the job done with this spray and I sprayed 12 plants in front and back that are getting eaten by our beloved deers ..lol. It don't clog and kept on spraying.
title: Works. Love it !!!

author: E in MN
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on January 8, 2021
review_content: In theory, this is great, but maybe mine is defective? The hose pops out as soon as you add pressure. I've taped it down, which hasn't worked so far. Next step is some kind of sealant/adhesive. I just wish there wasn't so much work and frustration involved. It seems like there should be some kind of piece that holds the connection.Other than that, I found it really useful.
title: I really wanted to like this

author: Don L.
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on April 26, 2021
review_content: I really like this sprayer. It has o-rings where there should be o-rings. No cheap plastic-to-plastic seals.  The plastic tubing seems to be a little stiff but isn't a problem at all in actual use.  I wish the wand were longer as I like to get close to weeds that I spray without bending over too much. But it's not a problem. The best thing is that the want can be snapped into the pump handle for storage. This was always a problem with my last sprayer. This is a well designed sprayer and surprisingly so considering the low price.
title: Well designed

author: TT of Boulder
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on May 5, 2020
review_content: I already have a nice 2 gallon sprayer with brass wand and tips.  To use different chemical, I have to transfer the content into an empty container, then clean and flush the sprayer before put in a different chemical.  This is time consuming and a pain to do it.  I purchased this in-expensive Chapin 1 gallon sprayer to save me all the hassle to use a second type of chemical.  To my surprise, this sprayer works very well even with the plastic wand and tip.  The smaller bottle also required to pump it less to hold proper pressure.  Not sure how this plastic tip will last but at this price, the sprayer will worth its value when it worn out.  I will buy 1 more for my 3rd chemical.
title: In expensive and works well.

author: JaStar
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on April 12, 2020
review_content: This was used repeatedly with multiple colors of concrete acid stain, rinsing with baking soda and water to neutralize in between colors/coats. I also used it to apply a water based concrete sealant afterwards. I am happy with the results and the fact that I was able to use this more than once. One star was removed because the nozzle did start to clog/drip over time even though I removed and cleaned it several times... Doing this sometimes helped, but not always. Luckily, this resulted in additional character to my floor pattern, so it was not too detrimental, but it is something to be aware of when using liquids that can develop increased viscosity over time.
title: Great for Staining and Sealing Concrete

author: E Mann
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on March 22, 2021
review_content: Was looking for dedicated weed control sprayer and wanted it easily portable.  We used to have a 2 gal sprayer that was used very few times and doesn't hold pressure anymore.  The Chapin name has a good reputation and the price was right.  Received within 1 day of ordering (have Prime, but didn't ask for 1 day, so that was nice).  Easy to follow instructions and assembly.  Did some testing and this thing is nice.  The "jug" portion feels very sturdy.  Pumps up, holds good pressure, and sprays well.  The tip, while plastic and nothing special, is adjustable and gives a very nice, direct stream to wide spray.  Well worth the minimal cost.
title: Beyond worth the money

author: Ursula
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on October 28, 2020
review_content: Oh-MY GOODNESS - this is the “Super Spreader” - as in getting the job done (not Trump Virus - 🤣).  Think this is my third or fourth sprayer and the very, very best. Just adjust nozzle to your liking and it just whizzes along with no clogging whatsoever and no sore hands either!  And the price - so reasonable for a very efficient garden sprayer. Do not hesitate - just order one - YOU WILL LOVE IT!’
title: Effortless spraying!

author: Kindle Customer

review_content: To be used for garden.  Easy to put together. Unfortunately, when assembled and trying to pressurize it would not seal. Could not get it to hold pressure. author: A. F. Cieszkiewicz
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on July 22, 2017
review_content: If first impressions are of any value, I was thrilled to find a complete parts list within the documentation.....no doubt in my mind that Chapin is realistic that their product may wear out so they provide a list of spare parts in stark contrast to other sprayers I have purchased and discarded when they could not be reliably serviced and repaired. Granted we have only used the sprayers 3-times in last week since delivery but our first impressions are quite favorable.The ratings for the product are positive that we verified with our first impressions.....the only caution is the classical recommendation that the buyer beware as we bought 3-individual sprayers at a substantial cost saving over the box of 3-sprayers on Amazon. title: First Impressions....

author: akm
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on April 22, 2021
review_content: These work as expected but the hose is VERY stiff and hard to handle and it can be difficult to turn the top valve to pump. Once you get it working, it does the job. I’ve had other similar sprayers that were much easier to operate with flexible hose and easy mechanism for pumping.
title: Does the job - but needs improvement

author: Mark G
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on April 3, 2021
review_content: Spend the extra few bucks on a sprayer with a valve this is not what I expected compared to my other sprayers. I was too lazy didnt double check and bough this one thinking it was the same. It doesnt have a valve and is not easy to operate compared to other brands in a similar price range.

author: R. S. Britton
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on November 26, 2014
review_content: This is my first experience with a bulk sprayer and, so far so good. I started spraying my walls and foundation last year with the Chapin 20000 sprayer to hold back the influx of tiny, little six-legged critters into the house and so far, I am impressed. This sprayer is really sturdy - one heavy-duty, single-piece molded polythene with a screw-on top-&-pump handle. It is easy to fill - it has a wide mouth with markings on the inside of the container for English and metric volumes. It is easy to carry - it is rugged, compact, and lightweight. The pump handle makes a convenient carry point and I have not felt the need for a shoulder strap. It is easy to spray - just pump it up, adjust the spray pattern at the nozzle, and press the lever to spray. One gallon will make it around the house about once without doing the windows; one-and-a-half gallons for everything and the patio is about right for us. Especially helpful: I came across a wasp's nest while spraying the walls last month and easily changed the spray from a fan to a high-pressure stream and hit the nest from about ten feet away ... and then I ran like a felon.Downsides: No release valve. You need to release any residual pressure by bleeding it with the wand and untwisting the top very slowly and carefully or you *will* get a faceful of whatever you are spraying. You have been warned. Also, lean the sprayer in something or against something when not in use; it does not stand well on its own. Nor is there a holster for the wand; again, lean it on something. When not in use, I store everything back in the carton it was shipped in and that keeps everything tidy at hand. For twelve bucks, this is a great deal. Recommended.Update, 31 Aug 2019:  Five years later and this baby is still going strong. Even more impressed, even more recommended, now (added 1 star to upe my review's rating to 5 stars.)

review_content: Very simple, very effective.  Have sprayed about 15 gallons of herbicide.  My rating factors in price, which at under $10 is a bargain. So it does get a bit tedious, and a 2 gallon sprayer would cut the refill cycles by half, but also increase carrying weight.  I did add my own strap by drilling through the two indents on the neck, put there for this purpose.  But with the one gallon spaying being so light and requiring such frequent refills, I would probably skip the strap if I was to do it again.  It's just not that heavy and the strap got in the way a bit during refills.  Spray pattern selections are wide, and the stream setting can reach at least 10 feet at full pressure.  Tabs that hold the handle down under pressure (with a twist to latch at full compression) appear to be plastic, so probably won't last long, but have lasted for 15 gallons at least.  I would have been happy to get just one large project done at this price, but it appears I will be able to many more.  Nice.

author: MuddyKnees

review_content: Love this sprayer!  Slight caveat.  This worked perfectly for fertilizing my plants and just misting with water my houseplants when it gets a bit dry indoors. So, using this fine sprayer, I proceeded to fertilize most of my plants with the good ol' (**ooof*) fish emulsion.  Why I decided to pump it good and tight while full of fish emulsion before removing the cap to wash it out, I do not know.  Why does my friend nearly always have to be right?  Anyhoo, off came the cap, and whaddayaknow, my entire kitchen got fertilized, the walls got fertilized, my clean dishes got fertilized, the floor, ... they all got fertilized.  Best of all, I got fertized, head to toe.  For well over a week, I washed and washed and washed EVERYTHING over and over.  It didn't matter.  Fish emulsion lingered.  Here.  There.  Above here.  Below there.  Under this.  Behind.  Beside.  Inside.  Out.  Why did my neighbor smell like fish emulsion?  My neurologist?  He sometimes asks me if I see things or hear things.  I couldn't quite bring myself to tell him I didn't see or hear anything, but I was sure smelling fish emulsion.

author: J. Miller
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on June 7, 2013
review_content: I bought this and Dragnet SFR-1 Quart to go to war with the tiny, tiny red mysterious bugs that were crawling all over our steps, patio, wood, and concrete.I'm a housewife. author: J. Hutchison
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on April 12, 2011
review_content: Quick review:+Cheap+Does the job (for the most part)-Trigger handle keeps failing - popping offFull review:I'll start with the good.  It sprays properly, and the construction of the tank seems to be very sturdy.  Compared to other sprayers, this one was very inexpensive.  It's pretty straightforward and easy to use.Now, the bad.  Every single thing is made of plastic.  This is fine of course, except for the "shut off handle" a.k.a. sprayer handle a.k.a. the trigger.  It's basically a plastic lever that needs to use a fairly large amount of force to pull the plunger upwards, causing the spray.  Apparently nobody told the designers that plastic bends with force, and therefore the little "forks" slip off the plunger very easily.Since this was the first time I used it, I sent a message to customer service on the company's website asking if there was a fix or replacement for the one part.  I have yet to hear anything back at all.EDIT: They were slow, but did finally get a response.  They are sending a replacement.  I'm adjusting the rating up a star because of this.To fix the problem, I brushed the plastic in a thin layer of JB weld.  Now, it doesn't slip off.Since most of the other reviews are positive and don't have this problem, I'm thinking it may be a certain batch with weaker plastic or something of that nature.  So, good luck with yours.
title: Cheap, but cheap.

review_content: The sprayer has paid for itself in that I’m buying refills and not new bottles (with sprayer ) of weed Control products.  It also allows me to mix up my own concoction of weed killer  using vinegar and dish soap.
title: Pays for itself.

author: Linda
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on April 13, 2021
review_content: This is an inferrior design. The sprayer hose hust pushes in with no lick or screw. When you pump the device it pushes the hose out snd get me sprayed as well. It’s hard to know when to stop pumping before this happens and you have to pump after only a few seconds of spraying.
title: Don’t but this. You get what you pay for.

author: Bad Kitty
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on July 17, 2015
review_content: Very happy with this!  I have lawn service so I don't use it to spray plants but I did just use it with water and some bleach to spray the inside of my very smelly wheelie carts.  I let them sit overnight and I just rinsed them with my hose.  Used to fill them with water and scrub them...yuck....then wrangle them to flip them and empty out the water.  Horrible waste of water too.  Garbage bins and my garage smell so much better.  Also just sprayed my walk in shower with tub and tile cleaner and let it soak.  Then used plain water in it to spray the cleanser off my shower and all the glass.  Beats using a bucket to rinse the walls and glass.....so much glass! Then I just used my squeegee to finish the glass.  Worked great!
title: Very happy.  So many uses.

author: Craig's Garage
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on September 19, 2018
review_content: This is about as heavy as I can lift any longer and bought to spray my tomatoes with Serenade spray to kill the blight from the heavy rains this summer, has nice pattern, can pump and spray for quite a while before needing to pump again, might make a bag for it and wear at the hip, be nice if it had a strap, but at this price I was happy at the performance alone. I have to crank it down pretty hard to get it to seal, not a real issue for me, may be for others.
title: Works great, have to crank it down though to seal.

author: Roger K.
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on July 9, 2020
review_content: This small sprayer is awesome.  I’d been paying about twice as much at the Hardwear store for a product that wasn’t nearly as good.  It’s light weight, and about the right amount to kill all the weeds in my yard. The sprayer handle is the easiest to adjust that I’ve used.  Excellent value for the money.
title: Sprayer

author: SurfCityGal
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on May 20, 2021
review_content: When I have a smaller job and don't feel like getting the Sun Joe out, this is the perfect solution. I like the one gallon size. Have used different kinds of liquids and never had a problem with clogging.
title: Perfect for smaller jobs

author: DWolvin
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on December 26, 2020
review_content: That only thing that would make it better is a pressure relief valve, but I can't imagine anyone accidentally bursting one...  But the funnel top makes it east to fill, and about 10 to 15 pumps seems to run about half a gallon of spray time.
title: Great simple sprayer

author: G. Farnsworth
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on May 18, 2018
review_content: I use this to apply pre-emergent to my lawn a couple of times a year.  This is only one gallon, so it's appropriate for a small HOA-style yard.  I use one gallon on my front yard and one on my back yard.  The good thing is that one gallon is lightweight.  But if you have a larger yard, I'd definitely recommend a larger size.This was easy to fill and pressurize and the spray quality was sufficient.  I'm satisfied and would buy again--either this or a two-gallon version of it.
title: Good quality for a small and cheap sprayer

author: Michael T. Walsh
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on July 11, 2014
review_content: I couldn't believe how affordable it was, so I was prepared for a letdown.  It turned out to be functional and reliable.  It's very easy to use!  Just a few pumps and it is pressured up, and it maintains pressure for a surprisingly long time.  The nozzle is adjustable to you can direct the pattern of the spray.Bonus:  If you don't want to use commercial weed killer, just buy some plain white vinegar.  Mix in a tablespoon or so of Dawn dish washing liquid, and a little salt, and you've got a serious weed killer.  I dilute it with water also, so I have about a 1 part water 2 parts vinegar solution.  The downside is that it will kill grass very effectively so you need to be careful spraying weeds that are in a lawn.  You will end up with holes to patch later.
title: Great delivery system for spaying weeds.

author: Jodi Ketchmark
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on February 9, 2020
review_content: Pretty good product for the price and arrived quickly, next day. Simple sprayer, nothing fancy but gets the job done. The one I purchased doesn’t have the continuous spray feature, the directions seem to be for various models with different options. So you do have to hold the sprayer down in order to spray, which can make your hand sore after awhile.
title: Good for price

author: Lucky Clucker
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on February 14, 2015
review_content: This is my third sprayer in as many years. Usually they quit spraying after a half-dozen uses. This one feels like all the rest with one exception: it has no release button to let off the pressure when you're out liquid. Here is what this means, when you open the top to clean the unit you get a blast of air and if you're not expecting it you get a face full of whatever is in the sprayer. This happened even after I thought I'd released all the pressure by depressing the wand lever.Anyhow,  maybe this will mean the seal on the unit will last longer. Now that I know what happens I just won't look directly at the unit while opening it.
title: Good so far

author: JackO
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on July 7, 2019
review_content: I bought 6 of these over the years to store herbicides and plant sprays. I recently bought 2 more and it seems they made a change in the nozzle. Before, you could get a very even fine mist spray perfect for herbicides. Now, it seems they switched a supplier as the spray pattern is very lopsided and coarse when you turn the nozzle to try for a fine mist. SO sad, it used to be great.
title: Used to love the Chapin sprayer

author: Robert Lyons
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on September 5, 2018
review_content: I just used this the other day for the first time. I had run out of Round up and used Bonide instead with this sprayer. It works well and hold a lot of product. It sprays very well when you first start spraying. The only complaint I had was that for a given number of pumps it did not last as long as the similar type of pump on a container of Round up. It didn't bother me that much but it just would be perfect if it lasted just a little longer between pumps.
title: Good Sprayer Destroying Weeds.

author: Juan
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on April 13, 2021
review_content: I sprayed my weeds but my vegetables, my bushes, my tulips are also turning white and die, because the spray nozzle fanning out too much. It needs to be more direct and focus for more accuracy. MY POOR TULIPS!
title: The spray nozzel needs to improve

author: Holly

review_content: So I actually purchased this as I have completely tiled shower, I'm short and I have 9 foot ceilings. title: It works for what I need it for

author: freddiegriggs

review_content: This unit has a well designed spraying wand and nozzle.  It's easy to get the desired width of dispersion.Downside is that the unit I received does not hold pressure. But I had hoped for better quality.UPDATE:  Scanned the reviews by "most recent" and noticed that over the past month or so there are markedly more negative reviews than before. Maybe a bad batch?  Or maybe the "quality fade" (google it) common of made-in-China products.
title: Doesn't hold pressure

author: D. Smith
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on August 3, 2017
review_content: Works very well. Easy to fill, assemble and use. A few pumps provides a significant amount of spray. While it is very easy to pull the trigger, when spraying a large space like a garden area, your hand will eventually begin to ache. A little locking mechanism would have really gone a long way. I would guess that other models have this feature.
title: Great Sprayer

author: Amazon Customer
